page.title: 08LABOUR
page.content: The ordinary rate for wholetime workers and part-time workers regularly working over 30 hours per week excluding overtime is Â£2.24 per hour for workers over 20 years of age. In an industry as well mechanised and technologically advanced as farming provision is made to reward, with higher rates of pay, employees who develop certain skills and crafts. To meet the higher labour demands created during the growing of many of the crops in this area large groups of casual workers are organised by gangmasters and hired out to farms as and when required, thus allowing farms to grow crops which need high seasonal inputs of labour without having to hold an uneconomically high number of permanent employees.
